definitions.definition: To make a low , heavy , continuous sound .
examples: If I don't eat, my stomach will rumble .
I could hear the thunder rumbling in the distance.

definitions.definition: To discover deceitful or underhanded behaviour .
examples: The police is going to rumble your hideout.

definitions.definition: To move while making a rumbling noise .
examples: The truck rumbled over the rough road.

definitions.definition: To provide haptic feedback by vibrating .
definitions.label_groups: video games , intransitive , of a game controller

definitions.definition: To cause to pass through a rumble, or polishing machine .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To make a low , heavy , continuous sound .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To discover deceitful or underhanded behaviour .
( intransitive ) To move while making a rumbling noise .
( slang , intransitive ) To fight ; to brawl .
( video games , intransitive , of a game controller ) To provide haptic feedback by vibrating .
( transitive ) To cause to pass through a rumble, or polishing machine .
( obsolete , intransitive ) To murmur ; to ripple .
